ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: When I am interacting with someone, I deliberately copy their body language or facial expressions.
Notes: 1=Strongly Disagree; 2=Disagree; 3= Somewhat disagree; 4=Neither agree nor disagree; 5=Somewhat agree; 6=Agree; 7=Strongly agree

ElementDescription: I monitor my body language or facial expressions so that I appear relaxed.
Notes: 1=Strongly Disagree; 2=Disagree; 3= Somewhat disagree; 4=Neither agree nor disagree; 5=Somewhat agree; 6=Agree; 7=Strongly agree

ElementDescription: I rarely feel the need to put on an act in order to get through a social situation.
Notes: 1=Strongly Disagree; 2=Disagree; 3= Somewhat disagree; 4=Neither agree nor disagree; 5=Somewhat agree; 6=Agree; 7=Strongly agree  (Reverse the scores)

ElementDescription: I have developed a script to follow in social situations (for example, a list of questions or topics of conversation).
Notes: 1=Strongly Disagree; 2=Disagree; 3= Somewhat disagree; 4=Neither agree nor disagree; 5=Somewhat agree; 6=Agree; 7=Strongly agree

ElementDescription: I will repeat phrases that I have heard others say in the exact same way that I first heard them.
Notes: 1=Strongly Disagree; 2=Disagree; 3= Somewhat disagree; 4=Neither agree nor disagree; 5=Somewhat agree; 6=Agree; 7=Strongly agree

ElementDescription: I adjust my body language or facial expressions so that I appear interested by the person I am interacting with.
Notes: 1=Strongly Disagree; 2=Disagree; 3= Somewhat disagree; 4=Neither agree nor disagree; 5=Somewhat agree; 6=Agree; 7=Strongly agree

ElementDescription: In social situations, I feel like I'm "performing" rather than being myself.
Notes: 1=Strongly Disagree; 2=Disagree; 3= Somewhat disagree; 4=Neither agree nor disagree; 5=Somewhat agree; 6=Agree; 7=Strongly agree

ElementDescription: In my own social interactions, I use behaviours that I have learned from watching other people interacting.
Notes: 1=Strongly Disagree; 2=Disagree; 3= Somewhat disagree; 4=Neither agree nor disagree; 5=Somewhat agree; 6=Agree; 7=Strongly agree

ElementDescription: I always think about the impression I make on other people.
Notes: 1=Strongly Disagree; 2=Disagree; 3= Somewhat disagree; 4=Neither agree nor disagree; 5=Somewhat agree; 6=Agree; 7=Strongly agree

ElementDescription: I need the support of other people in order to socialize.
Notes: 1=Strongly Disagree; 2=Disagree; 3= Somewhat disagree; 4=Neither agree nor disagree; 5=Somewhat agree; 6=Agree; 7=Strongly agree

ElementDescription: I practice my facial expressions and body language to make sure they look natural.
Notes: 1=Strongly Disagree; 2=Disagree; 3= Somewhat disagree; 4=Neither agree nor disagree; 5=Somewhat agree; 6=Agree; 7=Strongly agree

ElementDescription: I don't feel the need to make eye contact with other people if I don't want to.
Notes: 1=Strongly Disagree; 2=Disagree; 3= Somewhat disagree; 4=Neither agree nor disagree; 5=Somewhat agree; 6=Agree; 7=Strongly agree (Reverse the scores)

ElementDescription: I have to force myself to interact with people when I am in social situations.
Notes: 1=Strongly Disagree; 2=Disagree; 3= Somewhat disagree; 4=Neither agree nor disagree; 5=Somewhat agree; 6=Agree; 7=Strongly agree

ElementDescription: I have tried to improve my understanding of social skills by watching other people.
Notes: 1=Strongly Disagree; 2=Disagree; 3= Somewhat disagree; 4=Neither agree nor disagree; 5=Somewhat agree; 6=Agree; 7=Strongly agree

ElementDescription: I monitor my body language or facial expressions so that I appear interested by the person I am interacting with.
Notes: 1=Strongly Disagree; 2=Disagree; 3= Somewhat disagree; 4=Neither agree nor disagree; 5=Somewhat agree; 6=Agree; 7=Strongly agree

ElementDescription: When in social situations, I try to find ways to avoid interacting with others.
Notes: 1=Strongly Disagree; 2=Disagree; 3= Somewhat disagree; 4=Neither agree nor disagree; 5=Somewhat agree; 6=Agree; 7=Strongly agree

ElementDescription: I have researched the rules of social interactions (for example, by studying psychology or reading books on human behaviour) to improve my own social skills.
Notes: 1=Strongly Disagree; 2=Disagree; 3= Somewhat disagree; 4=Neither agree nor disagree; 5=Somewhat agree; 6=Agree; 7=Strongly agree

ElementDescription: I am always aware of the impression I make on other people.
Notes: 1=Strongly Disagree; 2=Disagree; 3= Somewhat disagree; 4=Neither agree nor disagree; 5=Somewhat agree; 6=Agree; 7=Strongly agree

ElementDescription: I feel free to be myself when I am with other people.
Notes: 1=Strongly Disagree; 2=Disagree; 3= Somewhat disagree; 4=Neither agree nor disagree; 5=Somewhat agree; 6=Agree; 7=Strongly agree (Reverse the scores)

ElementDescription: I learn how people use their bodies and faces to interact by watching television or films, or by reading fiction.
Notes: 1=Strongly Disagree; 2=Disagree; 3= Somewhat disagree; 4=Neither agree nor disagree; 5=Somewhat agree; 6=Agree; 7=Strongly agree

ElementDescription: I adjust my body language or facial expressions so that I appear relaxed.
Notes: 1=Strongly Disagree; 2=Disagree; 3= Somewhat disagree; 4=Neither agree nor disagree; 5=Somewhat agree; 6=Agree; 7=Strongly agree

ElementDescription: When talking to other people, I feel like the conversation flows naturally.
Notes: 1=Strongly Disagree; 2=Disagree; 3= Somewhat disagree; 4=Neither agree nor disagree; 5=Somewhat agree; 6=Agree; 7=Strongly agree (Reverse the scores)

ElementDescription: I have spent time learning social skills from television shows and films, and try to use these in my interactions.
Notes: 1=Strongly Disagree; 2=Disagree; 3= Somewhat disagree; 4=Neither agree nor disagree; 5=Somewhat agree; 6=Agree; 7=Strongly agree

ElementDescription: In social interactions, I do not pay attention to what my face or body are doing.
Notes: 1=Strongly Disagree; 2=Disagree; 3= Somewhat disagree; 4=Neither agree nor disagree; 5=Somewhat agree; 6=Agree; 7=Strongly agree (Reverse the scores)

ElementDescription: In social situations, I feel like I am pretending to be "normal".
Notes: 1=Strongly Disagree; 2=Disagree; 3= Somewhat disagree; 4=Neither agree nor disagree; 5=Somewhat agree; 6=Agree; 7=Strongly agree

ElementDescription: The sum of the Compensation score
Notes: Add up all answers for statements 1, 4, 5, 8, 11, 14, 17, 20, and 23.

ElementDescription: The sum of the Masking score
Notes: Add up all answers for statements 2, 6, 9, 12, 15, 18, 21, and 24.

ElementDescription: The sum of the Assimilation score
Notes: Add up all answers for statements 3, 7, 10, 13, 16, 19, 22, and 25.

ElementDescription: CAT-Q Total score
